quotes.quote: The psychotic drowns in the same waters in which the mystic swims with delight.
A neurotic is a man who builds a castle in the air. A psychotic is the man who lives in it. And a psychiatrist is a man who collects the rent.
Delusion completey overcomes man's sense of right and wrong.
Psychotic hallucinations, whether they are visual or vocal, they address you. They accuse you. They seduce you. They humiliate you. They jeer at you. You interact with them.
Other people have a nationality. The Irish and the Jews have a psychosis.
Being in love is a transient state of psychosis.

It only fed my post office psychosis. Whenever I’m in one, and almost to the counter, I keep repeating to myself: ‘Please don’t put out the “Position Closed” sign; please don’t put out the “Position Closed” sign; dear God, don’t let him put out the sign; please, please, please, I’m almost to the counter!
That’s another deep, dark secret,' I tell him, trying to make light of my own psychosis.
This guy was a real Pscyho' Mr. Levy said. 'To you character is a psychosis, integrity is a complex. I've heard it all before.'
A delusion is anything that one person believes is real, even if you present them with evidence to show that it cannot possibly be.
In intellectual and popular culture, war has come to be regarded by many as a peculiar psychosis of Western civilization.
Is it romantic or psychotic when I say I'll never let you leave me?
As psychotic as it gets outside, the comic can be more psychotic.
The neurotic has problems; the psychotic has solutions.
Psychotics are consistently inconsistent. The essence of sanity is to be inconsistently inconsistent.
All mystics have had psychotic breakdowns, although not all psychotics are mystics.
Everyone becomes psychotic in his or her own ways.
